intro: Oxytropis baicalia, commonly known as the Baical Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stems. It is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in alpine and steppe habitats. Oxytropis baicalia is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional Chinese medicine.
